channel.title: Botnet's
channel.description:
hey mopar ppl, few days ago there were some topcis about viruses well i download malwarebytes and found out there was nothing, but there is, its a netbot on my pc It came from the server "Destiny" it was suspisious when i saw it was port 995
anyways it gave me a botnet with random popping up interfaces ( today it was a chat where i could type in my bank pin)
or he was going to hack my facebook and stuff =/
oke so i want this botnet out of my pc but my scanners and firewall cant do shit about it....
and i dont want to end up on a russia mafia ID selling site where ppl can buy My identity and creditcard and stuff.......
so anyone knows how i can remove this botnet or disable it??
ow ye i request a ban for the owner of the topic destiny in server downloads.
thanks

item.title: Botnet's
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Just get an external HDD and back up everything you need to. Just get one for as much space as you need.

Read full topic

item.title: Botnet's
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:9, topic:416820”]you should post a hijackthis log

also see if you can stop it from starting when you boot your computer. Open regedit

find the following:

For Local Machine-
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Curr entVersion\Run
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Curr entVersion\RunOnce

For Current User-
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Curre ntVersion\Run
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Curre ntVersion\RunOnce

delete any key that shouldn’t be starting. restart computer see if they are still gone.

formatting is the sure method though. It’s not so bad if you backup your files. And your computer runs like new.[/quote]

thanks but the problem is i am a producer/dj and ive got all my plugins and music software on this pc and i cant remember how i getted some of this stuff
but i will backup what i can backup thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Botnet's
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

you should post a hijackthis log

also see if you can stop it from starting when you boot your computer. Open regedit

find the following:

For Local Machine- HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Curr entVersion\Run HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Curr entVersion\RunOnce

For Current User-
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Curre ntVersion\Run
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Curre ntVersion\RunOnce

delete any key that shouldn’t be starting. restart computer see if they are still gone.

formatting is the sure method though. It’s not so bad if you backup your files. And your computer runs like new.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

lostmyphat:

First of all I highly recommend you turn off the hacked pc, change all of your passwords to your personal info on a diff computer.

already did i am atm on my laptop and scanning my pc in safe mode

Read full topic
